answers.answer: Hi,This seasonal problem could be due to some allergic response of yor body.Think and  find out if there is some thing you get exposed to during this seasons.The most important finding will be a blood work during this season.Meet the psychiatrist and explain your problem.Do a CT/MRI to confirm that there is no other problem in you.Rule out diabetes and asthma which can have such vague symptoms.Goodluck.

Where do you live? Is your location at a high altitude? How is the weather there at those times? Your symptoms seem to point to a seasonal occurrence and your location or the weather during the months of November to February may have something to do with what you are experiencing.

question: Every year, usually around this time, Nov-Feb, I get these dizzy spells. And that turns into light headedness. Suddenly things become clear and I feel like I am having an epiphany or something. My finger tips tingle my brain feels numb, I know that sounds stupid. I had tests done and the results were good. I am healthy, but I keep having these episodes. I feel like im on some drug but I havent taken anything. At one point during the episode im so out of it I feel like im not in my body. Can anyone help me?
title: I feel out of my body
